intro: Taraxacum aethiopiforme, commonly known as the Ethiopian dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to regions of Africa, including Ethiopia, Somalia, and Sudan, and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that develop into elongated, bristled seed heads. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in some African cultures for its purported health benefits.
